channel.title: Dragon smithing
channel.description: I would like to add dragon ore, dragon bars and add dragon smithing. Does anyone know what it would take to add this into my 317 server? Or can someone point me in the right direction?

item.title: Dragon smithing
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“veraflows, post:10, topic:550296”] private final int[] SMELT_FRAME = {2405,2406,2407,2409,2410,2411,2412,2413};// 8

Can anyone tell me what these are referencing? Where can I find these id’s?[/quote]pretty certain theyre child frame ids for the interface

Read full topic

Again, a guess, at best.

item.title: Dragon smithing
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

for starters; the statement you copied to call the dragon method is still looking for rune/runite item names. and the dragon methods contain all the rune item ids

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon smithing
item.dc:creator: @veraflows veraflows
item.description:
@veraflows wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:6, topic:550296”]well for one,
all you did was copy the logic/configs for ‘rune’ and rename it to dragon. you didn’t edit the methods fully.[/quote]
I’m very new to this. How do I edit the rest of the methods?

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon smithing
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Your array sizes are also not the same:

private final int[] SMELT_BARS = {2349,2351,2355,2353,2357,2359,2361,2363,13271};// 9 private final int[] SMELT_FRAME = {2405,2406,2407,2409,2410,2411,2412,2413};// 8 private final int[] BAR_REQS = {1,15,20,30,40,50,70,85};// 8 private final int[] ORE_1 = {438,440,-1,440,444,447,449,451,13269};// 9 private final int[] ORE_2 = {436,-1,-1,-1,-1,-1,-1,-1};// 8 private final int[] SMELT_EXP = {6,13,-1,18,23,30,38,50,100};// 9

item.title: Dragon smithing
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/tutorials/117114-adding-dragon-smithing.html
^Something like this server sided…

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/models/577241-dragon-pickaxe-recolored-ints.html
^something like this client sided (mostly for the colors, to recolor…)

Basically:
Make new items client sided. Have them be a replica of any ore. Recolor it (using link #2) to the colors of the dragon armor.

Then server sided, add it just like all other smithing items are done (Link #1).

Read full topic
